SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

edu.uchsc.ccp.dmap
Class Parser

java.lang.Object
  edu.uchsc.ccp.dmap.Parser

public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object

The parser is the main entry point into the OpenDMAP system.

A parser connects a Protege Knowledge Base with a set of recognition patterns, which may come from a file or from the knowledge base. After loading this information, the parser can be used to look for references to Protege Frames in an input text.

When the parser "parses" an input text, it records all of the references to various Protege Frames, and other recognizable elements, that it finds in the text. These references are essentially descriptions of possible Protege Frame instances that might have been made in the text. Further non-DMAP processing is needed to decide what to do with these references.

Author:
Will Fitzgerald, R. James Firby

Constructor Detail

Parser

public Parser()
Create a new Parser.

This parser contains no patterns and does logging as specified in the standard Java logging utility configuration files.

Parser

public Parser(boolean retainCase)
Create a new Parser.

This parser contains no patterns and does logging as specified in the standard Java logging utility configuration files.

Parameters:
retainCase - True if this parser should pay attention to case in text strings, False if case should be ignored.

Parser

public Parser(java.util.logging.Level level)
Create a new Parser.

This parser contains no patterns, does logging as specified in the standard Java logging utility configuration files, and produces an output trace to System.out at the level of interest specified.

Parameters:
level - The tracing level for this parser.

public java.util.Collection<DMAPPropertyFunctionHandler> getPropertyFunctionHandlers()
Get the slot path property function handlers being used by this parser. These are reset each time the parser is reset.

Returns:
The property function handlers.

clear

public void clear(boolean all)
Clear the parsing state and and references recognized so far.

If the argument is supplied as 'true', then all anytime predictions will be removed and the recognition patterns will have to be loaded into the parser over again.

Parameters:
all - True to erase all known patterns, false to clear only dynamic state.

reset

public void reset()
Reset the parser for new input. This method is equivalent to clear(false).

This is the recommended way of resetting the parser between calls to parse input strings.

parse

public void parse(java.lang.String string)
Parse an input string to extract all the references.

Parameters:
string - The input phrase to parse

Add a new reference handler to the parser. This handler will be called when a reference to the specified Protege frame is recognized.

Parameters:
frame - The Protege Frame
handler - The handler to call when it is recognized

Parameters:
